security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation, templates, and instructions for generative art creation. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no shell commands. Templates load p5.js from CDN and Google Fonts as expected for interactive art viewer functionality.

content.user_title: Create algorithmic generative art with p5.js
content.value_statement: Users want unique generative art but lack algorithmic design knowledge. This skill creates original algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness, flow fields, particle systems, and interactive parameter exploration for customized visual outputs.
actual_capabilities: Create algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness for reproducible outputs
Implement flow fields, particle systems, and emergent behavior patterns
Design interactive parameter controls for real-time art exploration
Build self-contained HTML artifacts with color pickers and seed navigation
Generate procedural textures and mathematical visual compositions
Express computational aesthetics through parametric variation and controlled chaos
limitations: Creates algorithmic art based on user prompts, does not modify existing artwork
Output is limited to code-based generative art in HTML format
Does not integrate with external design tools or export to vector formats

use_cases.title: Create unique art pieces
use_cases.description: Generate original algorithmic art with flow fields, particles, or emergent patterns for portfolios and exhibitions

use_cases.title: Prototype visual systems
use_cases.description: Rapidly prototype generative visual systems with seeded randomness and interactive parameter tuning

use_cases.title: Demonstrate algorithmic concepts
use_cases.description: Show computational aesthetics and algorithmic philosophy through live code demonstrations

prompt_templates.title: Flow field art
prompt_templates.prompt: Create algorithmic art featuring a flow field with thousands of particles following Perlin noise vectors. Use a sophisticated color palette with 3-5 colors. Add parameter controls for particle count, flow speed, noise scale, and trail length.

prompt_templates.title: Particle emergence
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate particle-based algorithmic art where particles interact and emerge into complex patterns. Include controls for particle count, interaction radius, movement speed, and color variation.

prompt_templates.title: Geometric recursion
prompt_templates.prompt: Create algorithmic art based on recursive subdivision or L-systems. The work should show self-similarity across scales. Add parameters for recursion depth, branching angles, line weight reduction, and randomization.

prompt_templates.title: Quantum harmonics
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate algorithmic art based on discrete entities exhibiting wave-like interference patterns. Particles on a grid with phase values that evolve through sine waves. Include frequency, amplitude, and color parameters.

output_examples.input: Create algorithmic art inspired by organic turbulence with particles flowing through layered noise fields
output: Parameters: particle count, flow speed, noise scale, trail length
Interactive color palette with 3 customizable colors
Seed navigation: prev, next, random, jump to specific seed
Self-contained HTML artifact ready for claude.ai artifacts

best_practices: Use seeded randomness with randomSeed() and noiseSeed() for reproducible art across sessions
Design parameters that emerge naturally from the algorithm rather than arbitrary controls
Keep algorithmic philosophy guiding the code structure rather than copying predefined patterns
anti_patterns: Avoid copying existing artists work or styles - create original algorithmic expressions
Do not use static templates - each artwork should reflect its unique algorithmic philosophy
Avoid excessive parameters that do not meaningfully affect the visual outcome

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. The generated HTML artifacts run in any modern browser.

faq.question: What are the output size limits?
faq.answer: Generated canvases are 1200x1200 pixels by default. Export to PNG is supported with one-click download.

faq.question: Can I integrate with external tools?
faq.answer: The skill generates standalone HTML files. You can open exported files in any browser or embed them in web projects.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill runs entirely locally during generation. No user data is collected or transmitted. Only public CDN resources are loaded.

faq.question: Why does the art look different each time?
faq.answer: Each seed produces a unique but reproducible variation. Use the same seed to get identical results across sessions.

faq.question: How is this different from static image generators?
faq.answer: This skill creates living algorithms with interactive parameter exploration, not static images. Users can adjust controls in real time.
